name: alfalfa/grass silage production | alfalfa-grass silage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21582/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of alfalfa/grass silage in the region of South Africa. An average yield is 5 tonnes/ha (wet mass) is assumed (the most recent yield data available is for the 2006/2007 growing season, thus it is assumed that yields have stayed relatively constant over the years).;;Government agricultural statistics in South Africa do not disaggregate between dry hay and silage, thus the total production volume of 1.186 million tonnes applied in this dataset for the 2016-2017 growing season is for both of these products (DAFF, 2017). ;;The dataset is modelled with 61% of lucerne grown under irrigation, with the percentage grown under dryland conditons and that grown under irrigated conditions taken from the 2006 growing season (the latest for which this information is available). Inputs for dryland and irrigated lucerne cultivation are obtained from farm budgets, academic publications and the FAO. Emissions are calculated from fertilser and pesticide inputs.

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends after harvest and storage at the farm gate.
The dataset includes the inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers, pesticides and all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, swathing, haying, bulk loading for hay ensiled. Direct field emissions are also included. Use of car, van, or pick-up for servicing people (e.g. from farm to field) is excluded from the activities.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the region of South Africa.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data are intended to reflect current equipment and processes.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Energy and material inputs, as well as land use and production (yield) are from commercial enterprise budgets (Combuds) for lucerne farms in South Africa (five irrigated and two dryland). The National LucerneTrust (NLT, 2008) and academic publications provided further sources of inputs, planting schedules etc. References are provided in the comment fields). A breakdown in the kind of fertilisers used is obtained from the FAO (2005). Lucerne production volumes and areas are obtained from government agricultural statistics (
DAFF, 2017). Reference(s): FAO (2005) Fertiliser Use by Crop in South Africa, Food and Agriculture Organisation ofo the United Nations, Available at: ftp://ftp.fao.org/agl/agll/docs/fertusesouthafrica.pdf. (Accessed August 2017); NLT (2008) Official Website, National Lucerne Trust, Available at: http://www.lusern.org/. (Accessed October 2017); DAFF (2017) Abstract of Agricultural Statistics 2017, Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of South Africa, Available at: http://www.daff.gov.za/Daffweb3/Portals/0/Statistics%20and%20Economic%20Analysis/Statistical%20Information/Abstract%202017.pdf. (Accessed September 2017).

flow.name: Cadmium II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to soil/agricultural

exchanges.description: Modelled according to the 2006 IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories. Default emission factor of 0.3 kg N input emitted as NO3 (kg NO3-N) applied to production under irrigation, which accounts for 61% of total production in South Africa. An emission factor of zero was assumed for dryland alfalfa production, as prescribed. See supporting documentation for further details.

exchanges.description: This figure represents P2O5 from MAP (11% N, 52% P2O5), DAP (18% N, 46% P2O5), based on the nitrogen input, with the remainder assumed to be SSP. Total amount of P as P2O5 based on average mineral application rates, a breakdown of the mineral nutrient by fertiliser type based on that of national mineral fertiliser demand (FAO, 2005) and average yield of 5tonnes/ha (Stats SA, 2007).  See details for disaggregation in supporting documentation. Reference(s): FAO (2005) Fertiliser Use by Crop in South Africa, Food and Agriculture Organisation ofo the United Nations, Available at: ftp://ftp.fao.org/agl/agll/docs/fertusesouthafrica.pdf. (Accessed August 2017); Stats SA (2007) Census of Commercial Agriculture, 2007: Financial and Production Statistics, Available at: http://www.nda.agric.za/docs/statsinfo/Censcoagric2007.pdf. (Accessed September 2017).

exchanges.description:
Proxy for alfalfa seed. Figure is weighted average of seed consumption for irrigated and dryland production systems for lucerne and the % breakdown of production by irrigated and dryland production. The seed consumption from commercial enterprise budgets (combuds) for the Western Cape (DAFF, 2008a), North West (DAFF, 2008b), KwaZulu-Natal (KZN DARD, 2012), and Free State (Computus, 2016). Reference(s): DAFF (2008a) Commercial Enterprise Budget - Lucerne Hay - Establishment and Maintenance in Bree River Valley, Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of South Africa; DAFF (2008b) Commercial Enterprise Budget - Lucerne Hay - Establishment and Maintenance in North West, Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of South Africa; 
KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017); Grain SA (2014) Conservation Agriculture: Part 8, Grain South Africa, Available at: http://www.grainsa.co.za/conservation-agriculture:-part-8. (Accessed September 2017); Computus (2016) Enterprise Budgets 2009/2010, Computus Management Information (Pty) Ltd, Available at: http://www.computus.co.za/Publikasies/Vertakkingsbegrotings15Engels.pdf. (Accessed September 2017).

exchanges.description: Estimated using annual frequency of 1 and 100% mechanical operation. The frequency and breakdown of mechanical versus manual field work process data for conventional irrigated wheat in South Africa was used as a proxy for lucerne ploughing, seedbed preparation, sowing, and organic and synthetic fertiliser application (FAO, 2015). Using this data and the correlating ecoinvent datasets, the total diesel consumption [kg/ha] was determined, which correlated well with the total diesel consumption reported in the commercial enterprise budgets for irrigated lucerne in the KwaZulu-Natal Province (KZN DARD, 2012). Reference(s): FAO (2015) Online Database:  Global Database of GHG Emissions Related to Feed Crop, Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations, Available at: http://www.fao.org/partnerships/leap/database/ghg-crops/en/. (Accessed September 2017); KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'alfalfa-grass silage' is calculated to be circa 1.50E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'gypsum, mineral', 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.00E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Overall yield for 2015/2016 growing season of 5 tonnes/ha equates to 1.98 ha/kg. Due to lack of more recent data, the yield was assumed to be the same as that for the 2006/2007 growing season (Stats SA, 2007). Reference(s): Stats SA (2007) Census of Commercial Agriculture, 2007: Financial and Production Statistics, Available at: http://www.nda.agric.za/docs/statsinfo/Censcoagric2007.pdf. (Accessed September 2017).

flow.name: Transformation, to pasture, man made
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/land

exchanges.description: The exchange has been updated from 'potassium chloride, as K2O' into 'potassium chloride' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0005 kg by 1.5829 kg of 'potassium chloride' per kg of 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: This figure represents K2O from KCl. Total amount of K as K2O determined from the calculated nitrogen application rates and the typical mineral ratio of nutrients N:P:K annually consumed by lucerne in the region (FAO, 2005). K2O based fertilisers are all imported, with the bulk of imports being KCl. See details for disaggregation in supporting documentation. Reference(s): FAO (2005) Fertiliser Use by Crop in South Africa, Food and Agriculture Organisation ofo the United Nations, Available at: ftp://ftp.fao.org/agl/agll/docs/fertusesouthafrica.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

exchanges.description: For the swathing, haying and fodder loading field processes it was estimated that approximately 3 cuttings would take place throughout the year, based on a first cutting yield of 1.5-2 tonnes/ha (KZN DARD, 2012) and the assumption that 100% of these processes were performed mechanically. The fodder loading dataset includes cutting, loading and transportation of the cut lucerne to the farm to be ensiled. A density of approximately 800kg/m3 was assumed. Using this data and the correlating ecoinvent datasets, the total diesel consumption [kg/ha] was determined, which correlated well with the total diesel consumption reported in the commercial enterprise budgets for irrigated lucerne in the KwaZulu-Natal Province (KZN DARD, 2012). Reference(s): KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

exchanges.description: This figure represents the mass of the active ingredient for the pesticides Rogor (Dimethoate) and Folimat (Omethoate). The average application rates were each extracted from commercial enterprise budgets for irrigated lucerne in the North West and Western Cape provinces, South Africa (DAFF, 2008a; DAFF, 2008b). It was assumed that the application rate would be the same for irrigated and dryland per tonne of lucerne. Reference(s): DAFF (2008a) Commercial Enterprise Budget - Lucerne Hay - Establishment and Maintenance in North West, Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of South Africa; DAFF (2008b) Commercial Enterprise Budget - Lucerne Hay - Establishment and Maintenance in Bree River Valley, Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries of South Africa.

exchanges.description: Calculated from the blue water use for lucerne production in one of the major lucerne growing regions in South Africa (Vaalharts) (Scheepers and Jordaan, 2016) and the irrigated national tonnages according to the AgriCensus. This gives a water use per irrigated tonne of lucerne produced of 170 m3/tonne. In this dataset, 61% of lucerne is grown under irrigation. References: Scheepers M. E. and Jordaan H. (2016) Assessing the Blue and Green Water Footprint of Lucerne for Milk Production in South Africa, Sustainability 2016, Volume 8 (49), Available at: file:///C:/Users/lenov/Downloads/sustainability-08-00049.pdf. (Accessed September 2017); Stats SA (2007) Census of Commercial Agriculture, 2007: Financial and Production Statistics, Available at: http://www.nda.agric.za/docs/statsinfo/Censcoagric2007.pdf. (Accessed September 2017).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to soil/agricultural

exchanges.description: Based on the dolomite lime consumption recommendations of 3 tonnes/ha for irrigated lucerne in commercial enterprise budget for KwaZulu-Natal province of South Africa, with yield of 15 tonnes/ha (KZN DARD, 2012). Dolomite lime is composed of 50% CaCO3 and 40% MgCO3, this figure represents lime as CaCO3. It was further assumed that the rate of application of lime (as CaCO3) would be the same for irrigated and dryland lucerne per tonne. Reference(s): KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

flow.name: Ammonia
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: For the swathing, haying and fodder loading field processes it was estimated that approximately 3 cuttings would take place throughout the year, based on a first cutting yield of 1.5-2 tonnes/ha (KZN DARD, 2012) and the assumption that 100% of these processes were performed mechanically. The fodder loading dataset includes cutting, loading and transportation of the cut lucerne to the farm to be ensiled. A density of approximately 800kg/m3 was assumed. Using this data and the correlating ecoinvent datasets, the total diesel consumption [kg/ha] was determined, which correlated well with the total diesel consumption reported in the commercial enterprise budgets for irrigated lucerne in the KwaZulu-Natal Province (KZN DARD, 2012). Reference(s): KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

exchanges.description: Modelled according to the 2006 IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories. See supporting documentation for further details.

flow.name: Dinitrogen monoxide
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Estimated using annual frequency of 1 and 50% mechanical operation. The frequency and breakdown of mechanical versus manual field work process data for conventional irrigated wheat in South Africa was used as a proxy for lucerne ploughing, seedbed preparation, sowing, and organic and synthetic fertiliser application (FAO, 2015). Using this data and the correlating ecoinvent datasets, the total diesel consumption [kg/ha] was determined, which correlated well with the total diesel consumption reported in the commercial enterprise budgets for irrigated lucerne in the KwaZulu-Natal Province (KZN DARD, 2012). Reference(s): FAO (2015) Online Database:  Global Database of GHG Emissions Related to Feed Crop, Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations, Available at: http://www.fao.org/partnerships/leap/database/ghg-crops/en/. (Accessed September 2017); KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Based on CO2 emissions from limestone and urea application calculated from C content (IPCC, 2006). Emission factors are EF=1.57 kg CO2/kg N for urea, and EF=0.44 kg CO2/kg CaCO3 for limestone. See supporting documentation.

flow.name: Phosphate
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description: The exchange has been updated from 'urea, as N' into 'urea' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0007 kg by 2.1438 kg of 'urea' per kg of 'urea, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Based on average mineral application rates, a breakdown of the mineral nutrient by fertiliser type based on that of national mineral fertiliser demand (FAO, 2005) and average yield of 5tonnes/ha (Stats SA, 2007).  See details for disaggregation in supporting documentation. Reference(s): FAO (2005) Fertiliser Use by Crop in South Africa, Food and Agriculture Organisation ofo the United Nations, Available at: ftp://ftp.fao.org/agl/agll/docs/fertusesouthafrica.pdf. (Accessed August 2017); Stats SA (2007) Census of Commercial Agriculture, 2007: Financial and Production Statistics, Available at: http://www.nda.agric.za/docs/statsinfo/Censcoagric2007.pdf. (Accessed September 2017).

exchanges.description: For boron (B) micro-nutrient suppl, where low levels of boron are present. Average of recommended application rates of boron applied in this dataset, ranges from 0.5-3kg/ha depending on the type of soil, i.e. medium textured or sandy (NLT, 2008). Borax anhydrous is at 21.47% boron. Reference(s): NLT (2008) Lucerne Management: Fertilisation, National Lucern Trust of South Africa. Available at: http://www.lusern.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=148&Itemid=222. (Accessed August 2017).

flow.name: Nitrogen oxides
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of alfalfa-grass silage is calculated to be circa 1.71E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'borax, anhydrous, powder', 'molybdenum', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.42E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Average molybdenum requirement, based on sodium molybdate application rate of 0.45 ka/ha for irrigated lucerne in commercial enterprise budget for KwaZulu-Natal province of South Africa, with yield of 15 tonnes/ha (KZN DARD, 2012) and molybdenum (Mo) requirement of 100g/ha. It was assumed that the rate of application of agricultural gypsum would be the same for irrigated and dryland lucerne. Reference(s): KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. (Accessed August 2017).

exchanges.description: Based on the agricultural gypsum consumption recommendations of 0.4 tonnes/ha for irrigated lucerne in commercial enterprise budget for KwaZulu-Natal province of South Africa, with yield of 15 tonnes/ha (KZN DARD, 2012). It was assumed that the rate of application of agricultural gypsum would be the same for irrigated and dryland lucerne. Reference(s): KZN DARD (2012) Production and Marketing of Lucerne, KZN Agriculture & Rural Development, Available at: http://www.kzndard.gov.za/images/Documents/RESOURCE_CENTRE/GUIDELINE_DOCUMENTS/RESEARCH_REPORTS/Lucerne%20Production%20and%20Marketing.pdf. Calculated value, see chapter 'CO2 binding' in '01 crop production-direct field emissions natural resources v1.2.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
